requirements: Prerequisites: BIS 623 and BIS 625; open to second-year Biostatistics doctoral, M.S., and M.P.H. students, or by permission of the instructors.
description:
This first term of a yearlong course affords students the opportunity to gain experience and practical knowledge on how to work as a practicing biostatistician. Students learn how to collaborate with an investigator on a clinical problem; design and implement statistical approaches to further clinical research efforts under the supervision of an instructor; and communicate effectively with nonstatistical audiences. There is a strong emphasis on developing effective oral and written communication skills.
Prerequisites: BIS 623 and BIS 625; open to second-year Biostatistics doctoral, M.S., and M.P.H. students, or by permission of the instructors.
title: Statistical Practice I
